answer: I shall observe the tenets of Taekwondo
I shall respect the instructor and seniors

extra.prompt: How should your feet be positioned in an Attention Stance (Charyot Sogi)
extra.answer: Heels touching to form a 45 degree angle

extra.prompt: How big should a parallel stance (Narani Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: A shoulder width between outside of feet, weight 50/50

extra.prompt: How big should a sitting stance (Annun Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: One and a half shoulder widths between big toes, weight 50/50

extra.prompt: How big should a walking stance (Gunnun Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: One shoulder width wide (sideways), one and a half shoulder widths long between the big toes, weight 50/50

extra.prompt: How big should an L-stance (Niunja Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: One and a half shoulder widths long in total, gap of 2.5cm, weight 70/30

Chon-Ji literally means 'heaven and earth', in the Orient it is interpreted as the creation of the world or the beginning of human history, therefore, it is the initial pattern played by the beginner. This pattern consists of two parts, one to represent heaven and the other, the earth

questions.prompt: How many movements does Chon-Ji have?

questions.answer: Yellow signifies the earth from which the plant sprouts and takes root as the Taekwondo foundation is being laid

extra.prompt: What does a pattern consist of?
extra.answer: A pattern consists of a combination of full power Taekwondo techniques against an imaginary opponent, designed to practice and perfect techniques, some of which might not otherwise be used

extra.prompt: The name of a pattern, the number of movements, or its diagram symbolises...
extra.answer: Either historical figures in Korean history, or instances relating to historical events

extra.prompt: What do the pattern meanings also demonstrate?
extra.answer: Pattern meanings demonstrate the use of one or more of the tenets, to give us inspiration to follow

extra.prompt: Why are Saju Jirugi and Saju Makgi not patterns?
What two stances are in Chon-Ji? (In Korean)
What two blocks are in Chon-Ji? (In Korean)

questions.answer: Dan-Gun is named after the Holy Dan-Gun, the legendary founder of Korea in the year 2333 BCE

questions.prompt: How many movements does Dan-Gun have?
What does three step sparring improve?

questions.answer: The plants growth as Taekwondo skills begin to develop

extra.answer: The aim in free sparring is to score points and are using Taekwondo as a sport. The objective is to only touch your partner without causing any pain or injury. No techniques are allowed below the belt or to the back. As well as developing focus, distance and timing, free sparring improves awareness and encourages agility along with spontaneous reaction. The scoring system awards 1 point for a hand technique to the middle or high sections, 2 points for a middle section kick and 3 points for a high kick to the head

As in English, the word for the double figure is placed in front of the single figure word, e.g. Twenty One = Sumul Hana, Twenty Two = Sumul Dool. Unlike our own decimal system, Korean counting is based on the number 9

extra.prompt: Count from 10 to 50 in Korean, in multiples of 10
When can punches and strikes be used?
extra.answer: Punches and strikes can be used against hard or soft targets. The aim is to smash, pierce, or penetrate. This is achieved by focusing the breathing and the other elements of power to the end of the technique. Both techniques accelerate in a relaxed manner throughout the execution, ending with a dynamic twist with tension

Thrusts are only used against soft targets. This technique reaches the target under tension and at a constant speed after its initial acceleration, exhaling throughout. This means they are effective anywhere on the line of attack

questions.answer: Do-San is the pseudonym of the patriot Ahn Chang-Ho, who devoted his entire life to furthering the education of Korea and its independence movement.

questions.prompt: How many movements does Do-San have?

questions.answer: Normal motion is performed at normal speed with a pause long enough to show when one move has completely finished and the next is about to begin. It has one sine wave movement and one breath for each technique.

extra.answer: When two or more moves are linked by one continuous breath

extra.prompt: In a right stance, a right technique is...
In a right stance, a left technique is...
All stances to the side are...
extra.answer: Neither left or right, therefore are neither obverse or reverse

If the right has more weight in an unequal weight ratio stance, is it a left or right stance?
If the left leg has more weight in an unequal weight ratio stance, is it a left or right stance?

questions.answer: Won-Hyo was the noted monk who introduced Buddhism into the Silla Dynasty in the year 686 CE

questions.prompt: How many movements does Won-Hyo have?

questions.answer: Blue signifies the heaven towards which the plant matures into a towering tree as training in Taekwondo progresses

questions.prompt: What are the components of the theory of power

extra.answer: Using their force, striking when your opponent moves in
Directing power to a small target area, tension for a split second
Balance and stability, using your reaction arm for dynamic stability
Utilising the breath, tense abdomen to breathe out on impact
Using the knee spring and hip twist to increase body weight on impact
Maximise speed, the most essential factor for power
Two or more moves performed in 'double-time' due to the second sine wave only being half of the normal sine wave, as you have less time to utilise the full range of movement

Two or more moves performed within the same sine wave that are linked by breath. The first move sets up the opening for the second, therefore the first is always a block and the second move is an attack. However, there are some exceptions
Used to show the practitioners movement, technique, breath control and timing. It demonstrates the synchronisation of hands, feet, eyes and breath, and is performed to the count of 4 seconds
A movement performed with no impact. This is because one does not intend to cause severe damage or trauma to the opponent when defending their attacks

questions.answer: It is the pseudonym of a great philosopher and scholar Yi I (1536 - 1584 CE) nicknamed the 'Confucious of Korea'. The 38 movements refer to his birthplace on 38 degrees latitude and the diagram represents a scholar

questions.answer: Joong-Gun is named after the patriot An Joong-Gun who assassinated Hiro-Bumi Ito, the first Japanese Governor General of Korea, known as the man who played the leading part of the Korea-Japan merger. There are 32 movements in this pattern to represent Mr An's age when he was executed at Lui-Shung Prison in 1910

questions.prompt: How many movements does Joong-Gun have?
How should your feet and weight be on a rear foot stance (Dwit Bal Sogi)?
questions.answer: One shoulder width in total, front ball of the foot sligtly touching the floor, body weight on the back foot
Red signifies danger, cautioning the student to exercise control and warning the opponent to stay away

questions.prompt: You are now classed as a senior grade. What will you do to ensure your training continues to improve and develop?

extra.prompt: What are slow motion techniques and what is the first pattern to use them?
extra.answer: Joong-Gun is the first pattern that incorporates slow motion techniques. These movements (palm pressing block and angle punch) are intended to demonstrate the theory of power, leaving out the element of speed. The other main elements being: reaction force, concentration, equilibrium, breath control and mass.

questions.answer: Toi-Gye is the penname of the noted scholar Yi Hwang (16th CE) and authority on neo-confucianism. The 37 movements of the pattern refer to his birthplace on 37 degrees latitude and the diagram represents a scholar

questions.prompt: How many movements does Toi-Gye have?

questions.answer: One step sparring is an advanced dicipline to execute an accurate, fast, decisive blow at the right time while defending effectively

questions.prompt: What are the 9 secrets of Taekwondo?
answer: To study the theory of power thoroughly (green belt theory card)
To clearly understand the purpose and meaning of each movement
To bring the movement of eyes, hands, feet, and breath into one coordinated action
To choose the appropriate tool for each vital spot
To become familiar with the correct angle and distance for attack and defence
To keep both arms and legs slightly bent while the movement is in motion
All movements must begin with a backward motion with few exceptions
To create a sine wave during the motion by utilising the knee spring
Exhale briefly at the moment of each contact, except during connecting motion

extra.prompt: What does step turning allow for?
extra.answer: Allows any change in direction from, can be executed with either foot, moving forward, backward, clockwise or anti-clockwise and can be combined with double stepping, shifting and or sliding

extra.prompt: What do spot turns allow for?
extra.answer: Only turn 180 degrees to face opponent behind, with this method both feet move to complete the turn. Generally the front foot will move first but on occasion the back foot can be moved first. The turn is executed after moving one foot onto the centre line of the stance and can be taken clockwise or anti-clockwise, depending which leg is forward. On completion the front leg will be opposite to the one before the turn
Pivot turns are used mostly in walking, sitting or diagonal stance and is executed when pivoting on both feet at the same time

questions.answer: Hwa-Rang is named after the Hwa-Rang youth group which originated in the Silla Dynasty in the early 7th century. This group eventually became the actual driving force for the unification of the three kingoms of Korea. The 29 movements refer to the 29th Infantry Division, where Taekwondo developed into maturity

questions.prompt: How many movements does Hwa-Rang have?

questions.answer: Black signifies the opposite of white, therefore signifying the maturity and proficiency in Taekwondo. Also indicates the wearer's imperviousness to darkness and fear

extra.answer: Sometimes used when attacking and blocking against a powerful attack. This increases the power and effectiveness of either the block or attack

questions.answer: Choong-Moo was the name given to the great Admiral Yi Soon-Sin of the Yi Dynasty. He was reputed to have invented the first armoured battleship (Kobukson) in 1592, which is said to be the precursor of the present day submarine. The reason why this pattern ends with a left hand attack is to symbolise his regrettable death, having no chance to show his unrestrained potentiality checked by the forced reservation of his loyalty to the king

questions.prompt: How many movements does Choong-Moo have?
